verses.roman:
mad-arcāṁ sampratiṣṭhāpya
mandiraṁ kārayed dṛḍham
puṣpodyānāni ramyāṇi
pūjā-yātrotsavāśritān

synonyms: mat-arcām—My Deity form; sampratiṣṭhāpya—properly establishing; mandiram—a temple; kārayet—he should construct; dṛḍham—strong; puṣpa-udyānāni—flower gardens; ramyāṇi—beautiful; pūjā—for regular, daily worship; yātrā—special festivals; utsava—and yearly holidays; āśritān—set aside.
translation: The devotee should more fully establish My Deity by solidly constructing a temple, along with beautiful gardens. These gardens should be set aside to provide flowers for the regular daily worship, special Deity processions and holiday observances.

purport.content: Wealthy, pious persons should be engaged in constructing temples and gardens for the pleasure of the Deity. The word dṛḍham indicates that the most solid means of construction should be employed.
